definitions.definition: Any gathered or curled strip of fabric added as trim or decoration.
definitions.example: She loved the dress with the lace ruffle at the hem.
to put the mind in a ruffle

definitions.definition: A low, vibrating beat of a drum, quieter than a roll; a ruff.
The connected series of large egg capsules, or oothecae, of several species of American marine gastropods of the genus Fulgur.
To make a ruffle in; to curl or flute, as an edge of fabric.
definitions.example: Ruffle the end of the cuff.

definitions.definition: To disturb; especially, to cause to flutter.
definitions.example: Her sudden volley of insults ruffled his composure.

definitions.definition: To grow rough, boisterous, or turbulent.
To become disordered; to play loosely; to flutter.
To be rough; to jar; to be in contention; hence, to put on airs; to swagger.
To make into a ruff; to draw or contract into puckers, plaits, or folds; to wrinkle.
To erect in a ruff, as feathers.
To beat with the ruff or ruffle, as a drum.
To throw together in a disorderly manner.
